revised_title: Observations on Muscular Action, Sea-Sickness, and the Salutary Effects of External Motion
tldr: The author investigates the duration of muscular action, the origin of sea-sickness, and the benefits of external motion. He suggests that the frequency of muscular contractions and the effects of inspiration can counteract the discomfort of sea-sickness, and that external motion can assist the circulation and improve overall health.
